findings.title: Setting Mint Cap to a Specific Value Is Prone to Front-Running
findings.description: Dram stablecoin is using the approval-like model to set the minting caps of different operators, thus it is prone to the same front-run issues as the approval mechanism. When using the setMintCap function directly, an operator could front-run the transaction and completely spend the old cap and then spend the new one again after setting the transaction goes through.

findings.title: Centralized Contracts with Upgrade Capability
findings.description: The Dram contracts are heavily centralized and can be upgraded, which might change their functions whenever necessary. The important actions in the contract are controlled by specific roles that manage things like creating or destroying tokens, as well as freezing accounts.

findings.title: Unprotected Roles Vulnerable to Misuse
findings.description: The Dram contracts have unprotected roles that are vulnerable to misuse by malicious parties due to lack of proper protection and setup.
